titles.title: Social Security Earnings Test Limitation Act of 1987
A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the earnings test for individuals who have attained retirement age.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 3/3/1987--Introduced. Social Security Earnings Test Limitation Act of 1987 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to remove the limitation on the amount of outside income which beneficiaries who have attained retirement age may earn without incurring a reduction in benefits.
